title: After 59 Deaths And 20 Years Of Legal Battle, Upahaar Fire Tragedy Accused Sentenced To Only One Year Jail - Indiatimes.com
text:
Bobins Abraham February 09, 2017 
The Supreme court on Thursday awarded one-year imprisonment to the Gopal Ansal, one of the two accused in the 1997 Upahar fire tragedy which left 59 people dead. 77-year-old Sushil Ansal, the second accused in the case was let-off by the court taking into consideration his age. 
PTI/ File 
Even though Gopal has been sentenced to a year in jail, he will only have to spend eight months behind the bars as he had already spent four months in jail. 
The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and the Association of Victims of Uphaar Tragedy have sought review of the Apex Court verdict, delivered on August 19, 2015, sending Ansal brothers to two years of rigorous jail term if they fail to pay Rs. 30 crore each within three months. 
PTI/ File 
Relatives of the victims expressed disappointment over the verdict and said that justice was denied to them. 
59 people trapped in the balcony class of the theatre had died due to asphyxia and more than 100 were injured in the subsequent stampede following a fire that broke out during the Matinee show screening of Hindi movie 'Border' on June 13, 1997. 
PTI/File 
After a lengthy trial, brothers Sushil and Gopal Ansal were found guilty of "causing death by negligent" charge. A Delhi trial court awarded them two years' rigorous imprisonment in November 2007. 
In December 2008, the Delhi High Court reduced the duo's sentences from two years to one year and they were granted bail by the Supreme Court on January 30, 2009. Don't Miss
